Title: Goodfellas
Description: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mob, covering his relationship with his wife Karen Hill and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito in the Italian-American crime syndicate.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Drama Films are serious presentations or stories with settings or life situations that portray realistic characters in conflict with either themselves, others, or forces of nature.

Director.Name: Martin Scorsese
Director.Bio: Martin Charles Scorsese is an American film director, producer, screenwriter, and actor. Born in Flushing, NY, he graduated New York University and is widely regarded as one of the greatest and most influential directors in film history. Scorsese has nine nominations for the Academy Award for the Best Director.

Name: Titanic
Description: A seventeen-year-old aristocrat falls in love with a kind but poor artist aboard the luxurious, ill-fated R.M.S. Titanic.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Drama Films are serious presentations or stories with settings or life situations that portray realistic characters in conflict with either themselves, others, or forces of nature.

Director.Name: James Cameron
Director.Bio: James Francis Cameron CC is a Canadian filmmaker. He attended Stamford Collegiate in Niagara Falls. Cameron holds the achievement of having directed the first two of the five films in history to gross over $2 billion worldwide.

Name: The Godfather
Description: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty in postwar New York City transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant youngest son.

Genre.Name: Crime
Genre.Description: Crime films is a film genre inspired by and analogous to the crime fiction literary genre. Films of this genre generally involve various aspects of crime and its detection.

Director.Name: Francis Coppola
Director.Bio: Francis Ford Coppola is an American film director, producer, and screenwriter. Born in Detroit, MI, Coppola graduated Univeristy of California and was a central figure in the New Hollywood filmmaking movement of the 1960s and 1970s.

Name: Taxi Driver
Description: A mentally unstable veteran works as a nighttime taxi driver in New York City, where the perceived decadence and sleaze fuels his urge for violent action by attempting to liberate a presidential campaign worker and an underage prostitute.

Genre.Name: Crime
Genre.Description: Crime films is a film genre inspired by and analogous to the crime fiction literary genre. Films of this genre generally involve various aspects of crime and its detection.

Director.Name: Martin Scorsese
Director.Bio: Martin Charles Scorsese is an American film director, producer, screenwriter, and actor. Born in Flushing, NY, he graduated New York University and is widely regarded as one of the greatest and most influential directors in film history.

Name: Forrest Gump
Description: The presidencies of Kennedy and Johnson, the Vietnam War, the Watergate scandal and other historical events unfold from the perspective of an Alabama man with an IQ of 75, whose only desire is to be reunited with his childhood sweetheart.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Drama Films are serious presentations or stories with settings or life situations that portray realistic characters in conflict with either themselves, others, or forces of nature.

Director.Name: Robert Zemeckis
Director.Bio: Robert Lee Zemeckis is an American film director, film producer, and screenwriter. Born in Chicago, IL, he attended Catholic grade school and Fenger Academy High School. Zemeckis is frequently credited as an innovator in visual effects.

Title: Heat
Description: A group of high-end professional thieves start to feel the heat from the LAPD when they unknowingly leave a clue at their latest heist.

Genre.Name: Thriller
Genre.Description: Thriller film, also known as suspense film or suspense thriller, is a broad film genre that involves excitement and suspense in the audience.

Director.Name: Michael Mann
Director.Bio: Michael Kenneth Mann is an American director, screenwriter, and producer of film and television. Born in Chicago, IL, Mann graduated from Wisconsin with a B.A. in 1965. He then earned a M.A. from the London Film School.

Title: Pulp Fiction
Description: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Drama Films are serious presentations or stories with settings or life situations that portray realistic characters in conflict with either themselves, others, or forces of nature.

Director.Name: Quentin Tarantino
Director.Bio: Quentin Jerome Tarantino is an American film director, screenwriter, producer, author, film critic, and actor. Born in Knoxville, Tennessee, Tarantino grew up in Los Angeles. He began his career as an independent filmmaker.

Title: Seven
Description: Two detectives, a rookie and a veteran, hunt a serial killer who uses the seven deadly sins as his motives.

Genre.Name: mystery
Genre.Description: Mystery is a fiction genre where the nature of an event, usually a murder or other crime, remains mysterious until the end of the story.

Director.Name: David Fincher
Director.Bio: David Andrew Leo Fincher is an American film director. His films, mostly psychological thrillers and biographical dramas. Born in Denver, CO, he graduated Ashland Hight School and received 40 nominations at the Academy Awards, including three for him as Best Director.

Title: Scarface
Description: In 1980 Miami, a determined Cuban immigrant takes over a drug cartel and succumbs to greed.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Drama Films are serious presentations or stories with settings or life situations that portray realistic characters in conflict with either themselves, others, or forces of nature.

Director.Name: Brian De Palma
Director.Bio: Brian Russell De Palma is an American film director and screenwriter. Born in Newark, NY, De Palma he is best known for his work in the suspense, crime and psychological thriller genres.

Title: Die Hard
Description: An NYPD officer tries to save his wife and several others taken hostage by German terrorists during a Christmas party at the Nakatomi Plaza in Los Angeles.

Genre.Name: Action
Genre.Description: Action film is a film genre in which the protagonist or protagonists are thrust into a series of events that typically include violence, extended fighting, physical feats, rescues and frantic chases.

Director.Name: John McTiernan
Director.Bio: John Campbell McTiernan Jr. is an American filmmaker. He attended the Juilliard School before graduating with a Master of Fine Arts from the AFI Conservatory in 1975.

Title: The Rainmaker
Description: An underdog lawyer takes on a fraudulent insurance companyAn underdog lawyer takes on a fraudulent insurance company

Genre.Name: Crime
Genre.Description: Crime films is a film genre inspired by and analogous to the crime fiction literary genre. Films of this genre generally involve various aspects of crime and its detection.

Director.Name: Francis Coppola
Director.Bio: Francis Ford Coppola is an American film director, producer, and screenwriter. Born in Detroit, MI, Coppola graduated Univeristy of California and was a central figure in the New Hollywood filmmaking movement of the 1960s and 1970s.

Title: Memento
Description: Memento chronicles two separate stories of Leonard, an ex-insurance investigator who can no longer build new memories, as he attempts to find the murderer of his wife, which is the last thing he remembers. One story line moves forward in time while the other tells the story backwards revealing more each time.

Genre.Name: Mystery
Genre.Description: Mystery is a fiction genre where the nature of an event, usually a murder or other crime, remains mysterious until the end of the story.

Director.Name: Christopher Nolan
Director.Bio: Christopher Edward Nolan CBE is a British-American film director, producer, and screenwriter. His films have grossed more than US$5 billion worldwide, and have garnered 11 Academy Awards from 36 nominations. Born and raised in London, Nolan developed an interest in filmmaking from a young age.

Title: Inception
Description: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O., but his tragic past may doom the project and his team to disaster.

Genre.Name: Action
Genre.Description: Action film is a film genre in which the protagonist or protagonists are thrust into a series of events that typically include violence, extended fighting, physical feats, rescues and frantic chases.

Director.Name: Christopher Nolan
Director.Bio: Christopher Edward Nolan CBE is a British-American film director, producer, and screenwriter. His films have grossed more than US$5 billion worldwide, and have garnered 11 Academy Awards from 36 nominations. Born and raised in London, Nolan developed an interest in filmmaking from a young age.

Title: Casino
Description: A tale of greed, deception, money, power, and murder occur between two best friends: a mafia enforcer and a casino executive compete against each other over a gambling empire, and over a fast-living and fast-loving socialite.

Genre.Name: Crime
Genre.Description: Crime films is a film genre inspired by and analogous to the crime fiction literary genre. Films of this genre generally involve various aspects of crime and its detection.

Director.Name: Martin Scorsese
Director.Bio: Martin Charles Scorsese is an American film director, producer, screenwriter, and actor. Born in Flushing, NY, he graduated New York University and is widely regarded as one of the greatest and most influential directors in film history.
